etymologies: late 19th century: via South American Spanish from Nahuatl, of imitative origin

definitions: a tree-dwelling bird of the guan family, with a loud harsh call. It is found mainly in the forests of tropical America.

notes.text: Genus Ortalis, family Cracidae: several species, in particular the plain chachalaca (O. vetula)

shortDefinitions: pheasant-like tree-dwelling bird of guan family, found mainly in forests of tropical America
